page.title: 07WORCESTERSHIRE FOOTPATHS
page.content:
Only two roads of any significance run through this block: the A4104 from Little Malvern to Upton, and the B4211 from Upton to join the A438 at Long Green. Other roads merely lead to and connect various houses and farms.
There are, however, many footpaths, the routes of which show that they were formerly used by farm workers. With increasing use of bicycles and motor cars, footpaths are no longer used in daily life and many have become impassable.
Many people recognise that walking is the best way to enjoy the countryside, so the Malvern Hills District Footpath Society was formed in 1973 with the objects of walking footpaths and repairing and replacing damaged stiles and footbridges.
